channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: IBM exec asks job candidates whether they think we are in an AI bubble as a make-or-break interview test
item.description: Do you think we’re in an AI Bubble? Even the experts can’t agree. And weirdly, your opinion on all this could decide whether you get the job.

item.title: Appeals Court Says Alina Habba, Former Trump Lawyer, Is Serving Unlawfully as U.S. Attorney
item.description: The judges wrote that the Trump Administration appeared to have become frustrated by legal and political barriers that have prevented its preferred U....

item.title: It’s Your Duty to Pay the Duty: Buyers Hit With Extra Charges on Packages
item.description: The end of a tariff exemption on goods worth $800 or less has left some U.S. shoppers with an extra shipping bill that must be paid before delivery.

item.title: College Students Choosing A.I. Majors Over Computer Science
item.description: At M.I.T., a new program called “artificial intelligence and decision-making” is now the second-most-popular undergraduate major.

item.title: Trump’s new tax policies will cut the wealthy’s philanthropy by over $4 billion—and middle-class donors can’t match the donations of MacKenzie Scott
item.description: Mega-donors like MacKenzie Scott and Melinda French Gates are funneling hundreds of millions of dollars into charitable causes—but Trump’s new tax pol...

item.title: The K-shaped economy means inflation hurts at the bottom and swells the assets at the top
item.description: “We had that kind of two-year period where the bottom was catching up and that talk of the K-shape went away,” said TSLombard economist Dario Perkins.

item.title: How upcoming business leaders are using AI to prep for high-stakes deal negotiations—and everyday interactions
item.description: Students at American University’s Kogod School of Business are learning how to use AI to sharpen the way they negotiate everything from job offers to ...

item.title: For ‘No Tax on Tips,’ the I.R.S. Gets Intimate
item.description: The Trump administration wants to exclude earnings from “pornographic activity” from a new tax break for tips. Will the I.R.S. know it when it sees it...

item.title: Disney’s ‘Zootopia 2’ scores biggest international opening ever for an animated movie with $556 million haul
item.description: It was the sixth biggest North American opening of 2025. But its biggest market was China, which made for nearly half of the film’s global total.

item.title: Sri Lanka Declares ‘Largest’ Disaster as Cyclone Death Toll Rises to 355

item.title: College Student Is Deported During Trip Home for Thanksgiving
item.description: Any Lucia López Belloza, 19, was detained by immigration agents at the Boston airport before a flight to surprise her family in Texas for Thanksgiving...

item.title: Zelensky Turns to Europe After Talks With U.S. Officials
item.description: Ukraine’s president met with President Emmanuel Macron of France on Monday as Steve Witkoff, President Trump’s special envoy, was traveling to Russia.
